name: extinguishment
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ] the action of stopping a fire burning: We need automatic fire fighting installations capable of achieving total control and extinguishment.
[ U ] the action of stopping or ending something: Is death any more than the simple extinguishment of life?
[ C or U ]
  law
  specialized the fact of destroying or removing a right, a contract, or a debt (= money that is owed to someone else) so that it no longer exists in law: The legal consequence was the extinguishment of the debt. If rights over the land are proven, their extinguishment can be the subject of a deal.
More examplesFewer examplesThis system would provide a possibility of extinguishment in the event of failure by the purely automatic system to control a fire in its initial stages. The county council advised me to apply to "extinguish" the right of way and at a public inquiry the extinguishment was supported.The extinguishment of the fishing rights was not upheld by the court.Under this regulation, debt extinguishments are no longer classified as extraordinary items.
